title:
Longitudinal Evaluation of Child Face Recognition and the Impact of
  Underlying Age
authors: Surendra Singh, Keivan Bahmani, Stephanie Schuckers
abstract:
The need for reliable identification of children in various emerging
applications has sparked interest in leveraging child face recognition
technology. This study introduces a longitudinal approach to enrollment and
verification accuracy for child face recognition, focusing on the YFA database
collected by Clarkson University CITeR research group over an 8 year period, at
6 month intervals.
subjects: Computing Research Repository/Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition
